summary: The American Family Act aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to establish a refundable child tax credit, with monthly advance payments. It introduces a new section 24A, outlining the monthly child tax credit, and section 24B, for credits for other dependents.  It also amends Section 7527A regarding monthly payments, updating eligibility criteria and payment processes. The bill includes inflation adjustments, income limitations, and provisions for possessions of the United States.  It also includes guidelines for addressing improper claims.
